Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Scott H
Reviews.Content: Needed a place to stay the night in the area and found this place close by. Quick and friendly check in, our room was simple, but extremely clean, and air conditioner worked great. Chili's right across the st, and close to stores and other restaurants. I Would recommend this place to anyone looking for a clean quiet room reasonably priced in the UDSU area.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and Location if in town for football game”
Reviews.Author: tbarr31
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice of a hotel, if staying in San Diego for a Chargers game. Qualcomm Stadium is within walking distance (about a mile each way), but more importantly, the Trolley station is right next to the hotel. Not only does the trolley go directly to Qualcomm Stadium, but also to many other local landmarks. The rooms are pretty typical for a Ramada (nothing too special), but the price is budget friendly. The complimentary wifi in the rooms was not working for my mobile device (iPod), but there was a public computer available in the lobby area. No other issues with the room or hotel. Typical continental breakfast was included with the room. There is a Chili's restaurant within walking distance, but not much else in the immediate area food wise. I will definitely stay at this hotel again, when I return to the area for a Chargers game.

Reviews.Title: “Looks are deceiving.”
Reviews.Author: sam h
Reviews.Content: At a glance the room was nice, however looks can be deceiving. The room was smaller than I expected, It was very dirty. What was really gross was the tub, it looked like it needed to be bleached it was so black. The bath mat looked like it was about 20 years old as well and never washed. The bed we slept on was hard as a rock and so I had horrible back pains. I also found hair on the pillows and sheets which grossed me out. The room comes equipped with a complimentary coffee machine with coffee... that was dirty with dried up coffee... one night there was band playing music from 8pm-3am nearby that kept us awake. We paid over 220$ with taxes and fees for two nights.. totally not worth it. Don't even bother! The free breakfast was a joke and you are better driving to starbucks. SO DISAPPOINTING!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a quick stay, not luxury”
Reviews.Author: Daralynn11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband for a week trip. We drove to LA for one day, and had driven in from las vegas and went downtown sandiego for a few days. Hotel was nice and clean, but nothing to shout about. If you want a basic hotel that will supply breakfast every morning (Which was pretty good, except for the fruit) this is your hotel. If you are looking for upscale luxury, this is not the place! you can hear the freeway in your room, and the tvs are older, but we weren't there most of the time, it was literally just a room to sleep, change and store our things

Reviews.Title: “Go for football, not for a place to see San Diego from”
Reviews.Author: sekaitraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel fulfilled our need to avoid traffic and public transportation congestion to go to a Chargers game at Qualcomm Stadium. We stayed on a Saturday night/Sunday night for $100.00 a night. We flew a long way to get there. The hotel is close to Qualcomm and Grantville MTS trolley station. We walked to and from the stadium with ease. We dined at a Chili's nearby as well. There was a freeway outside the room and it would have proven to be loud had we not drunk so much beer. I would stay here again if I was going to a Chargers game. There were a ton of fans using the hotel for the same purposes and it was a great atmosphere. The hotel met our expectations but I would not use it as a base of operations for seeing San Diego. Rest assured that there are multiple other options within the city or closer to beaches. Judging by some of the poorer reviews listed here, you can see that many transient guests used this hotel for city touring purposes and were disappointed. Although I question the reason why they choose this option for those purposes, I can see legitimacy in their complaint. So as noted in the title of the review, go for the game, otherwise make a more informed choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for a weekend!!”
Reviews.Author: doc_que
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Nov 19th (Sat) as we came into town for a football game. Keep in mind this wasn't some romantic weekend kind of thing, but we just needed a place that was clean, comfortable and centrally located to Qualcomm Stadium. I was very surprised as to how clean the facility was! My room was comfortable with upgraded mattress on the bed which was great. The bathroom was very clean, with no pubs missed by hurried staff. The rooms decor was current, but not over the top. Quite comfortable for around $70 / night!! Price even included a complimentary waffle bar breakfast the next morning. I will definitely stay there again under similar circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort,Value and Clean!”
Reviews.Author: arosa62
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night 11/19/11, room was clean,renovated and bed was super comfy! Mini fridge/microwave was nice. Parking is close to your room which is a PLUS to get in and out. We booked 3 rooms for 9 nine people,so the complimentary deluxe breakfast was adequate and staff was helpful. Freeway noise did not bother us, it was some guests who had arguments with their family so we heard the commotion late at night. Heated Spa was open late at night, our kids 21-28 had somewhere to hang out. Our age groups was 21 to 51, and few blocks nearby Chilis, Jack in the Box and bars was close for us for to get some drinks and food after the Charger game. Good price for the money, don't expect fancy if you're not gonna pay for it. We just don't look for value but must be comfortable and clean rooms without having funky smells. We'll stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel too close to freeway and toxic creek”
Reviews.Author: busanio
Reviews.Content: Outside of being punched in the head, this has to be the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. Let's start with the fact I drove 9 hours and encountered heavy traffic in heavy rain starting in Orange County, then found out where this hotel was really located. From the online description the hotel being near Seaworld and the Zoo I figured it really might have been, but it WAS NOT. The hotel is a motel-style high rise hotel with a couple of wings. The front overlooks a parking lot that borders the very busy Highway 8 through Mission Valley. The back overlooks several light industrial business and a thoroughly polluted small creek. The only good thing is that it's close to the Grantville station of the San Diego Trolley. The rooms were spartan, there were cockroaches (that we found on our food), and the night we stayed a fire alarm went off near midnight and wasn't shut off for over 35 minutes. We had such a miserable experience in a toxic creek view room that we checked out early even though we'd paid and drove speedily to a nice boutique hotel downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: simonr78
Reviews.Content: Hotel was good value, area is not that attractive, as right next to the freeway but easy enough to get around with a car. Facilities are good and staff are helpful.rooms are clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay for the purpose intended - Charger Game - Bolt Up!”
Reviews.Author: hfmstretch
Reviews.Content: First let me qualify this review....The wife and I stayed here for the discrete purpose of attending the charger (vs. 49ers) game and obviating the annoyance of the to/from stadium crowdedness. We typically opt for nightlife and nicer accommodations - one of our faves is Hotel Solamar. That said, I researched a number of hotels near qualcomm and found this one to have the most favorable outlook considering I wanted to stay in a semi-decent place that wasn't filthy but also wasn't pricey. Long story short: it was a TERRIFIC CHOICE! Check-in was smooth and the reception was efficient. Parking was near the room and we didnt mind climbing the stairs to our 3rd floor room (not sure if they had an elevator). The room is TINY but was very clean. The stacked appliances (microwave, fridge, safe) were convenient, although we did not use them. The bathroom was clean. The only negative was the archaic tube/box TV in the room that evoked a motel-ish feel to the room. Before game time we walked to the trolley station (3 min walk) from the hotel room, bought our all-day pass ($5/person) and waited (5 min) for the next trolley. After a 5 min ride and 3 min walk down the walkway we were at qualcomm! Very convenient and very efficient, much to our happiness. The return trip was even more convenient b/c almost everyone was headed in the opposite direction so our wait time for the trolley was insignificant compared to those headed back to Seau's/other direction- that was a great surprise and really sealed the deal relative to our acknowledgment that this was the best way for an out of towner to avoid long waits/crowds and attend a game at qualcomm. For that purpose, I highly recommend! Some reviews mentioned that the rooms were noisy b/c of the adjacent freeway, but we asked for a quieter room and got one opposite the freeway. Must do. I used the free PC/internet in the lobby which I have no complaints about. The free breakfast is a nice touch but I say skip it and go to the best breakfast spot around - The Mission (North Park) which you can get to in less than 20 mins. In fact, we were planning to go the location near the Gaslamp District but to our surprise and delight, found that they had a location so close to us. Great luck and really was the icing on the cake for this experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest”
Reviews.Author: bball33
Reviews.Content: Not somewhere I would stay again, pictures on website are not what we got. We stayed five nights, ugh, only because nothing else was available. Maid was re-using towels we had on the floor, hanging them back up like they were never used. Very small bathroom and bedroom area. Beds and pillows were very uncomfortable. We encountered a baseball team having a BBQ everynight in the parking lot, very loud and office did nothing. Pool and Jacuzzi area was dirty, never any towels to be found. Breakfast was ok. A few restaurants nearby and easy access to freeway was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good location inexpensive clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: katewalsh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for padres game. Trolley right there. Large room 2 beds. Pool small but this is the type of hotel you dont plan to lounge about This motel is fine for the money. Only complaint is the busload of kids on a trip roaming around the halls but have noticed it has stopped at 11 pm. Not bad!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Unhappy!”
Reviews.Author: lauralew_98
Reviews.Content: This motel is not what they present in the pictures and description! Very tiny room, scary neighborhood and the motel inside seems very cheap and unpleasant. We asked for our money back on two of the three night stay and have been refused, even though we never used the room or the facility. The manager WILL NOT return my calls. I will never stay in a Ramada again unless they at least attempt to make this right. At this time I have contacted Ramada the Official site. We'll see...... And lesson learned, never book a room thru Southwest. Once you commit, you have no way out. Next time I will just reserve with my credit card directly with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: seemeseeyou
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights there. It was clean. I felt safe. The neighborhood is light industrial/business with a car dealership, Home Depot, lots of places to eat for all budgets, Kaiser Permanente, grocery and drugstore, etc. The building exterior looks like it has been painted recently. The pool, gym and laundry room were all well maintained. The interior of my room looked recently renovated. No weird smells. Everything worked. Cold AC. Its near the freeway and I could hear some street noise outside, but not at all inside the room. All I heard was a wooosh from the train that passes overhead, not a harsh metal sound. I was concerned that at the price, there would be teens partying and other shady characters. Not at all. The other guests were mostly business travelers, families and tourists. Front desk service was surperb. The breakfast lady was friendly and efficient. My room was serviced perfectly. They really do arrange the pillows the way its shown on the website. No extra charge for the computer and printer in the lobby. Two freeway exits from SDSU. A short drive to the shopping district. San Diego Brewing Company is a nearby restaurant with good food, great prices and excellent service. If you're looking for a five star resort experience there are many options for you in SD. If you want a cheap, clean, safe place to stay with a pool and free breakfast choose this place! Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “A Roadside Motel”
Reviews.Author: clare_curtis1
Reviews.Content: Were were booked into this 'hotel' by our travel agent, when we arrived we were greatly dissapointed!! It is just off the sliproad of the freeway, so as you can imagine it is contantly noisy with traffic! i would avoid the pool as is situated in the middle of the carpark with no privacy so when people drive in they can clearly see you sunbathing, and you can also hear the contant traffic passing so it is not very relaxing. Breakfast was included but would give this a miss aswell, unless you like dry cereals, croissants and waffles, in a cafeteria like setting just inside the reception area! The double rooms are quite small and dingy, no net curtains so had to keep the curtains closed the whole time!, decoration was dated. It is also quite far from the downtown area, about 8 miles/ $30 in taxi / about 40 mins on the trolly service with a few changes, so not very convienient either! I would not recommend this hotel to anyone and we contacted our agent asap to be moved to a much nicer holiday in the downtown city of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - Nice Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: RhonaP
Reviews.Content: This was 1 of 3 hotels we stayed in during our visit to San Diego. I chose this hotel for 3 nights because of the price and we weren’t going to spend a lot of time in the room. Cons: 1. Location is right next to freeway and there is nothing walking distance. If your room is on the side facing the freeway you will hear the cars passing when the room a/c is not on. 2. There is a pool but it is on the freeway side. Pros: 1. Price of $60 from otel site is a very good deal expecially with the nice breakfast. . 2. Breakfast included - make your own waffles with 2 heavy-duty waffle makers, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, breads, muffins, danish, cereals. But Juices are watered down. 3. Room was clean, beds ok. Some rooms do have refrigerator. The 1st night had one but when we came back for 3'rd and 4th night, this room did not. 4. Marie Calendar and DZ Akins (NY style deli) restaurants are close by. 5. There is a fitness center that is small with about 4 pieces of equipment but at least there is one. This hotel is adequate if you just need a place to sleep and want a very nice breakfast included. Ask for a room away from the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: timorous
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights from july 5 checked out july 8. Wished we could of stayed more. The room was very cleaned the staff was very Friendly. The variety in the breakfast was wonderful. They had belgium waffles,fresh fruit ,fresh coffee , eggs , juice choice and much more. The Fitness center was great. My family loved the pool and hot tub. Overall Our experience was awesome. We will do this again next year for a week or two. Thank you Ramada !

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: latinqt2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights with our 2 yo daughter. Gave up a teeny-tiny room with a microwave and fridge for a more spacious room sans micro and fridge, but double beds. Rooms are updated and very clean. Conveniently located near freeway, so easy to get around San Diego, and I believe the trolly is near by as well. Even though it is next to the freeway, the noise was not an issue for us. Breakfast was good, very well stocked, so no issue as to what time you showed up for it. Internet access was great. Management called us on our second day and had to switch our room, yet again, for a plumbing issue (don't know if it was adjacent to us), but they were very kind about it, and we had no issue moving. Luckily they caught us before we left for the zoo.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: coach63
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five night stay at the Ramada Mission Valley. Everything was in order...no funky smells, everything worked, the staff was friendly, pool/rooms/lobby were very clean. The beds and pillows were also comfy...we expected less considering the price! The breakfast area each morning blew away our expectations by far...fresh toast, milk, coffee, juices, eggs, fruit, waffles, bagels, muffins and pastries! So, we got 20 breakfasts and our room for five nights...all for an amazing price! This hotel was 12 minutes from the Zoo and Seaworld, 14 minutes from downtown, and 18 minutes from Coronado. It is very close to Qualcomm stadium and several nice malls. Lots of good restaurants in the area too! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE HOTEL,, LOVELY PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: cool85
Reviews.Content: we went to sandeigo fro the family vacation. and stayed at this toel . very frendly and quite hotel. all the staff member are nice and very nicely dressed. manager was really frendly. very helpful with my kids. nice atmospher.. will go thereat every time whn i will visit san deigo ... very nice place to stay..... best place

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME LOCATION FOR QUALCOMM STADIUM TRIP! WORTH EVERY PENNY!”
Reviews.Author: bangbangbella
Reviews.Content: Wow – we couldn’t have asked for a better place to stay. This was our first visit to the Qualcomm Stadium area (football Sunday - January 3rd) and it was so convenient! Yards away from the trolley station, and a small walk up the hill. We drove from Los Angeles, arriving in the area at approximately 11:30AM. The hotel was just off the freeway. Clean, parking lot, ample spaces. Nice lobby with a small concession fridge that sold juices, snacks, etc. The clerk secured our room for an early check-in and told us to enjoy the game – that was it! Totally hassle free and two minutes later we walked five minutes up the hill to the trolley station and purchased an all day pass for $5.00. Parking in the trolley lot looked like it was an absolute nightmare, but we didn’t have to worry about it! We had already parked at the hotel in front of our room. Literally 15 minutes later we were exiting the station and walked right IN to Qualcomm stadium. We’ve never had an easier trip! Back at the hotel… our bed was so comfortable and the room was immaculate. No weird stains, odors or issues whatsoever. Even the spacious bathroom & shower had an adjustable head for me to wash off the shame of the Redskins’ loss to the Chargers. (Boo!) Nice complementary amenities, phone in the bathroom and crisp, bright vanity lighting. There was a fridge, microwave, coffeemaker – all pristine. Closet space was ample, and we even had a sitting area with table and two chairs. We seriously contemplated staying an additional night because the room was so awesome. Before booking, I initially saw other comments regarding the surroundings of the hotel. True – the neighborhood seemed like an industrial setting, but I mean, we weren’t sleeping outside. It is safe and QUIET- there are gas stations, stores and restaurants including a Chili’s within view of the hotel lot, and after partying so much at the game (complete with $9.00 beers!!! Yikes!!!), we just wanted a place to crash and burn afterwards. There was also a HUGE dining room and continental breakfast that I actually didn’t notice until checking out – so sorry I missed it! This hotel tops my recommendation of BEST hotels to stay for a visit to the Qualcomm Stadium or any locals adjacent to the trolley – (Old Town, Downtown, etc.) A+ to the pleasant staff at both check-in and check-out. The price & value of this Ramada can’t be beat. It will be our annual retreat for the Redskins/Chargers game every season.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Of Rock Bands”
Reviews.Author: zirc007
Reviews.Content: my wife and I stayed in San Diego for our Honeymoon. Our hotel room face the back parking lot. Apparently no noise by-laws restrict when a live band can play until. A near by bar had live entertainment and the band played until 2am. The front desk offered us earplugs. The room was small, it smelled, they tried charging us twice for the room, the internet was not working... you get the picture. It was our Honeymoon, so we made the best of it, but next time we will stay elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: shalom18
Reviews.Content: This is the only place for accomidations near Keiser Hospital on Zion Rd in San diego Ca. clean rooms , comfortable beds , pool very impressed

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Fraud!!”
Reviews.Author: sobaka34
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room for one night, was charged for two nights in very old and smelly room. I didn't realize I had to check out in person. I guess I should be greatfull they didn't charge me for a whole week. Manager was never available to talk to.

Reviews.Title: “Yikes is a good way to describe it. Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: Canada333
Reviews.Content: Our reservation for a non-smoking room was not honored. The town was booked up because of Comic Con, and we ended up settling for a smoking room that the management said was being converted to a non-smoking room, but it still stank. The outside walkways are filthy and stink. The southern side of the hotel is very close to an expressway, and the northern side of the hotel has an elevated train running within 100 feet of the windows. The manager was rude, inhospitable, and unhelpful. We know that non-smoking rooms were available the next day (we saw one offered to a walk-in customer) and we were not offered one within our three day stay. The hotel is also hard to find, and internet kept breaking down. The smoke detector in our room was disconnected and hanging from the ceiling. Bathroom was not clean. One of the bathroom towels showed up with a used fake fingernail inside it, which makes you wonder if they even wash them. If we did not have a child with us, we would have slept in our car or under a tree instead.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff, Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: last_week
Reviews.Content: The staff here were so welcoming. It was the little touches such as the big smiles from everyone when we entered the lobby to check in, to the phone call 15 mins after to our room to ensure everything was ok. The rooms were big, clean and comfortable. Unfortately I was struck down with food poisoning (not from the hotel!!) and so I was confined to my room. This was frustrating, but made more comfortable because I was in a nice room and could relax. Very easy access to Gaslamp etc including a tram, and I am assured the breakfast was great! This hotel is lovely and great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Again”
Reviews.Author: zerosix1
Reviews.Content: Went to San Diego for the annual DBack - Padre Game. As usual we stayed at the Ramada. I been staying there since it was the Super 8. Since Ramada took over, it has improved. Better room overall. Location is the best for me. Grantville Station is nearby so I don't have to drive anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Friendly, Clean and Professional”
Reviews.Author: vv5
Reviews.Content: I recently visited the Ramada Inn, Mission Valley, San Diego with a group of friends. We were there to visit another friend and I have never stayed at a Ramanda. With my friend's suggestion we decided to stay there. To my surprise the hotel was clean, well kept and I had a plesant stay. We enjoyed a nice complimentary breakfast. The area was kept clean and the food was fresh. Furthermore, the staff was friendly and fun. I felt like the staff greeted us and opened doors for us not because it was their job but because they wanted to. I had a great weekend and it was topped off by staying at a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Valdiri
Reviews.Content: First of all, you need to know that this property has changed hands. The previous reviews were written when this property was a ‘Super 8’ – Now it is a Ramada. Apparently the new owner has decided to invest in the property – and it shows. I stayed there for several days and I noticed that the whole exterior has been repainted, the pool area and the breakfast area look renovated. They told me there are new beds and bathrooms as well. While I was there, there were paving crews doing some minor asphalt repairs to what looked like a redone parking lot. The staff was helpful and friendly. I would say they are aiming for 2.5 star status… The complementary breakfast had small cheese omelets occasionally in addition to the regular toast, make-your-own waffles, cereal and yogurt. Heading others’ advice, I requested to stay on the top (3rd) floor and found it very quiet. My room had a decent-sized fridge and microwave. They have a mini-mart in the lobby that sells some frozen dinners, drinks, snacks, etc. Free Wi-Fi is available – it is very hit or miss though. I couldn’t get reception in my room, but it seemed to work very well by the pool. There is also a PC in the lobby area for guests to use… it is using the same wireless network though.. so it can be hit or miss as well. Cons – the comments made about the location still apply of course. There is lots of highway noise if you are facing the highway, and the view from the rear of the building isn’t picture postcard material. I found being close to the highway on/off ramp a bonus though. The only windows in each unit face the corridor, so if you leave the curtains open, everyone walking by can see in. Also, there is a surprise $1 per day additional charge at check-in for the room safe that is not included in your quoted price. Area: There is a Starbucks very close to the Ramada for your morning coffee (I don’t recommend the coffee they offer at breakfast). There are lots of restaurants on Mission Gorge Road as well as a Vons grocery store. A 5 minute drive down Mission Gorge Road takes you to Mission Trails park – a large city park that makes you think you are in the mountains.. worth checking out. Conclusion: For a clean, decent 2/2.5 * room at a great price (I got mine through Expedia) at a hotel with good staff that is obviously is trying hard, I say go for the Ramada Qualcomm.

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: steve1616
Reviews.Content: My family and I decided to spend a few days down in San Diego. Most of the hotels in the center of town were already booked. I have never stayed at a Super 8 before, and my opinion of the brand hadn't been too great. However, having no choice, we decided to go ahead and rent a room. We were pleasantly surprised. For a Super 8, this hotel surpassed our expectations. The room was clean and comfortable. The front desk agent was very nice; We didn't have our next day planned and didn't know where to go. He gave us several ideas on what to do, and gave us maps of the area. The next day we couldn't fit everything into the same day! I guess that's good, now we have a reason to go back to San Diego. We will stay at this same hotel. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap choice... Nothing else...”
Reviews.Author: robertocusato
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night, only because we hadn't a room booked and couldn't find anything better... Well, I must say, the place isn't anything special at all, it's not very clean, staff isn't really helpful and city centre is quite far, but there are some ups too: free parking, bathroom was ok (room was small), all in all a safe place where to stay and some good eating location around the place. Wouldn't recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty sheets!”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoMom_2_6
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed her 4/11/2008 for a Christian women's conference at nearby Cox Arena. We stayed here because most Hotels were booked and this was in walking distance of the trolley station which would easily shuttle us to SDSU without having to be in I8 rush hour traffic and deal with parking structure. The selection of danish, muffins, fruit at lobby was good. HOWEVER: My friend noticed hair in her bed, (We thought might be the maid's hair) but upon further investigation, sheets were indeed dirty with yellow stains, etc. I wanted to go to the front desk and get my friend clean sheets (My bed was fine) but she wouldn't let me make an issue of it. Giving them the benefit of the doubt, it may have been a stayover in which the beds were made but not changed and then only one bed was unmade when the last people checked out and only the one bed may have gotten cleaned by the maid on the day of checkout. Or they could have been stained (Bleach them then Super 8) However...I will NEVER stay in this motel again because that totally grosses ME out. If it was MY bed I definately would have walked down 3 flights of stairs for clean sheets! I did mention it to the front desk in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good access to ride the trolley”
Reviews.Author: huskertravelers
Reviews.Content: Our stay was May 31,2006. This was our first time to try a Super 8. I was a little apprehensive since it was rated as a lower end budget hotel. We were very comfortable and pleased with the accommodations for our family of 5. The room was very basic, average size, clean and well maintained. The breakfast was adequate and the pool looked clean. The staff was friendly. We liked the easy access to the trolley system just a 5 minute walk away! The only down side....this hotel is hard to find and the directions are hard to follow even with our GPS tracker. Diane

Reviews.Title: “Simple”
Reviews.Author: mojo404
Reviews.Content: I came for a wedding and was put up there. They had the bare requirements. Not going to complain too much.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great staff”
Reviews.Author: LuvtoTravelFamily
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for two nights in San Diego and had a great time. There were no problems with the room and the staff was very friendly. We would stay here agin next time we are in town.

Reviews.Title: “The worst”
Reviews.Author: timm_tm
Reviews.Content: Where to start...First of all, we had trouble finding the place turned out we needed to go around the block and look for a little sign on the sidewalk. The parking is terrible. The building was under construction at the time. We checked in (I took notice the lobby was nothing like they had on their website) and went upstairs in a stinky, riggity old elevator to the 3rd floor. I requested a n/s room and they put us next to 2 rooms that were under construction and our room stunk of mold and smoke and was dusty from the construction. So they moved us to the end of the hallway; which we did not notice the big plastic tarp hanging at the end (it was dark when we arrived). The room was ok, but very drafty. I woke up to being cold, the bed was hard, hearing the plastic flapping in the wind, and the people shouting across the way. (I literally came home with a tremendous earache and had to go the doctor for an inner ear infection.) We complained to management when we checked out and they took a whole $20.00 off per night. (We stayed for 2 nights because there was something going on in town.) My boyfriend told them also that I was going home sick do the draftiness of the room (Oh, yea the heater forget it.) and all they could say was: are you sure she wasn't sick before." NO!!! I definitly would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone. I would rather have spent the night in my car or at grandma's.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Super 8”
Reviews.Author: azjoe35
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 4 days and 3 nights and had a wonderful experience. If there were previous issues with cars being broken into, I think that the property has installed a security fence that surrounds the parking lot may have helped. Check-in was easy and fast as was parking. I found the room to be above average as far as Super 8's go. No issues with the room equipment or cleanliness. I actually thought the bathroom was much better than most Super 8's. We faced the I-8 freeway but with the A/C on, we didn't hear any traffic. In fact, the motel looked pretty full but we never even heard any noise in the room above or outside our 2nd floor room. One day we decided to ride public transportation and the trolley station is a short 5 minute or less walk away. I have nothing negative to say about this Super 8 and would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for Price”
Reviews.Author: OntheGo2day
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a week-long vacation to San Diego. We were a little nervous after reading the reviews, but I must say we were pleasantly surprised. The room was very clean and obviously recently renovated. Most hotels in the local area were around $200/night, so I would say for the price we paid, it was certainly worth it. The room was small, but our family of 4 (2 kids ages 9 and 7) managed just fine. The continental breakfast was pretty good and the staff was very friendly. The pool was tiny (limit of 15 people at a time). It's situated in the middle of the parking lot, which I didn't like. We didn't use the pool, so it didn't become an issue. The location was good, and our room was quiet, although occassionally we could hear the people above us stomping around. We didn't spend much time in the room...we were out and about all day and came back to the motel to shower and sleep. Our purpose was served. The towels are thicker than the ones at the Super 8 we stayed at in Carlsbad. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal if you can book cheap through Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: reenboe
Reviews.Content: My above average rating is based on the fact that I was able to book my stay through Hotwire at $39.00/night. Check out the retail cost to stay here and do a Hotwire search and if you get a 2 star result for an establishment that shows as being in the Kearny Mesa area and retails for what this place does, it is probably this motel. I would say that there isn't enough of a difference between this place and a Motel 6 to make it worth staying here if you have to pay full price. This is a no frills establishment, but my room was clean and quiet. I don't know if the quiet was due to the room not being on the side closest to the traffic, but you can probably offset any traffic noise by simply turning the fan on on the air conditioner and creating white noise. The parking area in the back seemed a little secluded and creepy, but even though my room was on that side of the motel I tried to park in the front parking lot where I felt my (new) car was more visible and safer. Forget the continental breakfast. I don't know...maybe there were more offerings earlier on than there were when I got there shortly after 9, but all that I found available were donuts, raisin bagels and cold cereal. They didn't even have a toaster for toasting the bagels. The office staff were very friendly. I think that if you are satisified with simple, basic accomodations, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “WIsh I could go back in time and have never stayed!”
Reviews.Author: mkanski
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night for a local event and ended having our car broken into and the stereo stolen. In the morning we were told "Oh yeah, there have been a lot of break-in's lately." Nice to be told ahead of time!! The room was just OK for the price, but definetely wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed by the hotel. It was actually much nicer than we had anticipated. From check-in to check-out the staff was very friendly. The rooms were very spacious and clean. The rate was very reasonable for San Diego and even included breakfast in the morning. It is a few miles from the San Diego attractions but it was very conveniently located a few feet from the Trolley line that connects you to most areas of the city. Next fall we will definitely stay at this hotel again. A Great Bargain!

Reviews.Title: “loads of military kids”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights here, its just a place to stay, nothing more or less. You will need a car and dont leave anything valuable in it. The place was crawling with young marines half of which were entertaining the local girls. The other half were entertaining the local boys.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good place”
Reviews.Author: mugsylv
Reviews.Content: This hotel was disgusting. Me and my brother checked out immediately after checking in because the beds were infested with bed bugs or mites. Thre were also some larger bugs in the room and it was not very clean. I would highly recommend choosing another place.

Reviews.Title: “Yikes!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Super 8 Mission Valley was not somewhere I would recommend staying. The lobby was clean and nice, but my room was another story. I noticed the bed was a bit lop-sided, so I looked to find the bed frame was broken. That wasn't the creepy part. The box spring and mattress was full of dried blood and other very dark stains that did not show any attempt of being cleaned off. The hotel does not provide you with wash clothes, you need to go to the front desk to get them if you want them. I would suggest bringing your own washclothes anyway, as I am uncertain of the hygene practices of the hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Ramada Mission Valley / SDSU
HotelInfo.Address: 4380 Alvarado Canyon Road, Hwy 8 & Mission Gorge Road, San Diego, CA 92120-4301
